result.execSummary:
The defendant Brennen L Stitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No costs ordered for this case. 1 day credit in the event of revocation. Conditions the same as those stated for 16CF125.

16CF127, 16CM144, 16CF125, and 17CF40 called together. 

Defendant Brennen L Stitzer in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty McD states they are prepared to settle all matters today; parties jointly recommend the following: 3 year DPA, 3 year probation, 8 months in jail. 

17CF40, def pleads guilty to count 3. 
16CM144, def pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. 
16CF125, def pleads no contest to count 1 and guilty to counts 2 and 4. 
16CF127, def pleads no contest to count 2.
The State will dismiss but read in the other counts. 
Def enters pleas to the counts stated. Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of guilty.
Counsel and Def address the court. 

Court orders: 

16CF125
3 year diversion agreement on count 1, the felony
Withheld sentence for 3 years probation on counts 2 and 4 with conditions as follows:  No contact with the alleged victim except as allowed by the agent. Submit to psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any education and/or training ordered by the agent including 24- or 26-week domestic abuse education class, attendance at which to be at the agent's discretion. Costs ordered for count 2 only, 60 dtp, pay to the Clerk of Court. Costs will be remitted by the Court in all other counts pleaded to in this and the other cases today. 40 hours community service. Restitution of $1210 (pay to the Clerk of Court). 2 days credit. Huber. Bond to be converted to 5k signature bond, remaining in place for count 1 during the 3 years of the DPA.
Counts 3, 5, and 6 DRI.

16CF127 - Count 2
Withheld sentence for 3 years probation, conditions the same as 16CF125. 4 days credit. No costs. Counts 1, 3, 4, and 5 DRI.

16CM144 - Counts 1 and 2
Withheld sentence for 3 years probation. 1 day credit. No costs. Counts 3, 4, 5, and 6 DRI.

17CF40 - Count 3
8 months jail to begin immediately with 20 days credit and huber. No costs. Counts 1 and 2 DRI.
Status conference on May 24, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Def from R Co Jail

Status in 16CF127, 17CF40, 16CF125, and 16CM144. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Brennen L Stitzer. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brennen L Stitzer appeared by video means. ADA Forehand asks for setover; parties are close to resolution.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 17, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Atty McD would like to complete arraignment today and setover for a status. State has filed information in both matters, just not been processed. Court states charges and informs def of max possible penalties. Def pleas NG to charges in all cases.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Court inquires on status of these matters.  Atty. M states def will be waiving right to prelim in the CF cases. 

Court conducts prelim waiver colloquy in 16CF125 and 16CF127.  Waivers accepted.

Forehand notes that the State is withdrawing its motion.  Atty. McDougal requests prelim in Jan or early Feb for the CF cases.  Court sets 1/19 at 2 for CF prelims and CM status. ADDRESS INFO for Brennen L Stitzer

Adjourned initial appearance on December 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brennen L Stitzer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  16CF127/initial, 16CF125/adjourned initial, 16CM144/initial.  In 16CF125, Atty. McDougal argues against State's motion to forfeit bond; notes that, at a hearing last week, Court allowed 5k to be returned to the original poster in 16CF125 and then 5k was posted by someone else; doesn't believe it's right that there's now a motion to forfeit that bond since the DA was okay with the request to return the original 5k. Court states it's not considering that motion at this time as it was just filed. Atty. M asks that all three cases be setover for adjourned initial. Court would rather set these matters for prelim. Atty. M doesn't want prelim set; wants to determine if there are four corners issues.  Court to Atty. M - those issues could be brought before the prelim. Defense waives prelim time limits.  12/2 at 10:30 - Court will allow these to be set as adjourned initials.

Court conducts the initial appearances in 16CM144, 16CF125, and 16CF127 with stating of the charges and possible max. penalties.

Atty. M asks that def be provided copies of his bail bonds in these matters.  Def has indicated that he never received them at the RCSD.  Court informs def that that is not an excuse for not following conditions.  Clerk directed def to COC office for that information.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
